title: chore(ngdocs): ensure that the search container shows and hides itself properly
fix($compile): don't use new with minErr
body:
Someone wrote `throw new $compileMinErr(...)` when it should have been
`throw $compileMinErr(...)`. This caused a build warning.

title: fix(ngdocs): make jsFiddle and Plunkr links work with external AngularJS modules
fix(docs): Fix nav list bar css
body:
Fixes #3262.

/cc @matsko could you take a look at this and make sure it doesn't break anything?

title: Removed pointless line in compile.js
body: This line does not do anything within the compile function, removed it.

title: feat(ngMock): allow $timeout::flush to take a delay parameter
body: Allow $timeout::flush at ngMock to take a `delay` parameter that defines the time in millis that should be flushed

title: feat(ngMobile): Emit 'swipeleft' and 'swiperight' events
body:
Similar to ngMobile clicks, these events were not capturable by other
directives. Now they emit 'swipeleft' and 'swiperight' events that can
be follow with element.on('swipeleft', ...).

Fixes #3130.

title: feat(minErr): Include version number in prod minErr urls
chore(ngdocs): replace showdown.js with marked.js
chore(.gitignore): ignore npm-debug.log file
remove superfluous });
docs($animator): fix doc signature for enabled()
body:
The `enabled()` method shows up incorrectly in the docs, i.e.:

| Param | Type | Details |
| ---------- | ------ | ----------- |
| If | Boolean | provided then set the animation on or off. |

...because the `@param` declaration doesn't have the parameter name.

title: fix(ngMobile): Emit click event for touchy clicks
body:
Previously, no handlers for the click event would be called for the
fast, touch-based ngMobile clicks, only for desktop browser clicks. Now
the event will fire properly for all clicks.

title: fix(select): don't support binding to select[multiple]
body:
changing the type of select box from single to multiple or the other way around
at runtime is currently not supported and the two-way binding does odd stuff
when such situation happens.

we might eventually support this, but for now we are just going to not allow
binding to select[multiple] to prevent people from relying on something that
doesn't work.

BREAKING CHANGE: binding to select[multiple] directly or via ngMultiple (ng-multiple)
directive is not supported. This feature never worked with two-way data-binding,
so it's not expected that anybody actually depends on it.

Closes #3230

title: fix(ngMobile): prevent ngClick when item disabled
body:
- the ngClick attribute was always triggered, regardless the ngDisabled/disabled attributes
 - we now check the DOM disabled status before triggering the original click event
 - deals with #3124 #3132 /cc @shepheb
 - also adds `ngClick` event, replacing PR #3219, which fixes #3218.

title: mention the controller along the scope
mention the controller along the scope
body: the default description can be more precise by illustrating what the controller applies to

title: add formatting
body: the string literal {{query}} was missing as it was not enclosed into ``

title: describe more what the unit test does
body: The default description lacks essential information

title: fix(ngMock): allow $timeout.flush to check against the timeout delay
fix($$urlUtils): remove dependency on $window
body:
$window may be mocked out in tests causing those tests to fail.  So
don't use $window.

title: docs(bootstrap): Note that ngScenario requires ngApp
body:
ngScenario expects an ngApp directive to be used, and doesn't work for
manually bootstrapped apps. The failure mode is to hang on navigation.

Trying to make this wont-fix bug less obscure by documenting it.
Eventually Protractor will replace ngScenario and fix this.

title: Ng bind html sce
body:
Changes:
- remove ng-bind-html-unsafe
- ng-bind-html is now in core
- ng-bind-html is secure
    - supports SCE - so you can bind to an arbitrary trusted string
    - automatic sanitization if $sanitize is available

BREAKING CHANGE:
  ng-html-bind-unsafe has been removed and replaced by ng-html-bind
  (which has been removed from ngSanitize.)  ng-bind-html provides
  ng-html-bind-unsafe like behavior (innerHTML's the result without
  sanitization) when bound to the result of $sce.trustAsHtml(string).
  When bound to a plain string, the string is sanitized via $sanitize
  before being innerHTML'd.  If $sanitize isn't available, it's logs an
  exception.

title: Under certain circumstances location.href is not defined in IE8.
body: It sometimes causes an infinite routing loop.

title: feat(copy, equals): copy and equals can now handle cyclic structures.
Make $urlUtils public and add a resolve callback
